However, one of the vampires discovers a boy whose unique blood antigens hold the key to curing her kind - and risks her own safety to protect the child from government agents determined to kill him. Sci-fi thriller, starring Milla Jovovich, Cameron Bright and Nick Chinlund.(n)

programme.title: Inherent Vice
programme.desc: A drug addled private detective unwittingly becomes embroiled in an elaborate kidnapping case in Los Angeles during the 1970s involving an old flame, her billionaire boyfriend and his wife. Comedy drama based on Thomas Pynchon's acclaimed novel, starring Joaquin Phoenix, Josh Brolin and Reese Witherspoon.

programme.title: The Outlaw Josey Wales
programme.desc: A Confederate soldier refuses to surrender at the end of the Civil War, and is branded a dangerous outlaw. Crossing America in search of sanctuary from the army and bounty hunters, he only wants solitude - but ends up with a strange assortment of travelling companions. Western, directed by and starring Clint Eastwood. With Chief Dan George and Sondra Locke.

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: A wage-slave in his uncle's factory has big ambitions. Just as he comes close to marrying a wealthy socialite, a poor working-class girl with whom he had a brief, casual affair tells him she is pregnant with his child. When she threatens to disclose the truth, he makes a series of decisions which bring terrible consequences in their wake. Oscar-winning drama, starring Montgomery Clift, Shelley Winters, Elizabeth Taylor,and Raymond Burr.

programme.title: The Face of an Angel
programme.desc: A journalist and a documentary-maker become obsessed with the murder case they are covering. Fact-based drama inspired by Amanda Knox's case and the death of Meredith Kercher in 2007, starring Daniel Bruhl, Kate Beckinsale and Cara Delevingne.

programme.title: The Hurricane
programme.desc: Boxer Rubin `Hurricane' Carter dreams of winning the middleweight world title, only to be wrongfully thrown into prison for the murders of three people in a bar. Nineteen years later, a teenager reads the fighter's autobiography and sets out on a campaign to free him. Fact-based drama, starring Denzel Washington, John Hannah, Deborah Kara Unger, Liev Schreiber and Dan Hedaya.

programme.title: For a Few Dollars More
programme.desc: An enigmatic gunslinger forms an uneasy alliance with a military veteran to track down a notorious outlaw - but tensions simmer as their very different motives for the hunt put them increasingly at odds. Sergio Leone's Western sequel, starring Clint Eastwood, Lee Van Cleef, Gian Maria Volonte, Josef Egger, Mara Krup and Klaus Kinski.

programme.title: East of Eden
programme.desc: The son of a farmer struggles to cope with his father disregarding him in favour of his brother, as well as the revelation that his supposedly dead mother is alive and running a brothel. America's coming involvement in the First World War gives him an idea for a business venture that he hopes will earn the old man's respect. Drama based on John Steinbeck's novel, starring James Dean and Raymond Massey.

programme.title: Insomnia
programme.desc: A detective is sent to Alaska to investigate a murder during a month when the sun does not set. Sleep deprivation starts to take its toll, and he accidentally shoots his partner dead. He tries to cover it up, but the criminal they were hunting has seen everything and blackmails the cop into helping him escape justice. Thriller directed by Christopher Nolan, starring Al Pacino, Robin Williams and Hilary Swank.

programme.title: Blackhat
programme.desc: A computer hacker is released from prison after being convicted of committing cyber crimes. He's immediately enlisted by the FBI when they discover that one of his software codes is being used as part of a terrorist plot. Crime drama, starring Chris Hemsworth, Leehom Wang and Viola Davis.

programme.title: White Bird in a Blizzard
programme.desc: A teenager relishes her newfound freedom when her mother goes missing, seizing the opportunity to flirt with the boy next door and a cop on the case. Over time, she begins to realise what she has lost and finds the unexplained details of the disappearance haunting her. Mystery based on Laura Kasischke's novel, starring Shailene Woodley and Eva Green.

programme.title: Wild at Heart
programme.desc: An Elvis-obsessed ex-con and his lover set off on a nightmarish journey across America pursued by a variety of bizarre and deadly characters. David Lynch's dark road movie, starring Nicolas Cage, Laura Dern, Diane Ladd, Willem Dafoe, Harry Dean Stanton and Isabella Rossellini.

programme.title: A Clockwork Orange
programme.desc: Sadistic young gang leader Alex leads a carefree life indulging his love of rape, violence and classical music. When he is finally arrested, he is subjected to a sinister form of aversion therapy that brainwashes him into being physically unable to use violence. However, on his release, he finds friends and family have turned on him, while others seek to exploit him to further their political ends. Drama, starring Malcolm McDowell and Warren Clarke.(n)

programme.title: The Devils
programme.desc: A sexually liberated priest in 17th-century France attracts the hatred of the King and the church with his radical views. When an obsessed nun accuses him of witchcraft, the cleric's enemies strike, using increasingly brutal tactics in their efforts to prove him a heretic. Ken Russell's historical drama, starring Oliver Reed and Vanessa Redgrave.(n)

programme.title: East of Eden
programme.desc: The son of a farmer struggles to cope with his father disregarding him in favour of his brother, as well as the revelation that his supposedly dead mother is alive and running a brothel. America's coming involvement in the First World War gives him an idea for a business venture that he hopes will earn the old man's respect. Drama based on John Steinbeck's novel, starring James Dean and Raymond Massey.(n)

programme.title: National Lampoon's Animal House
programme.desc: A college's most slobbish and unruly student fraternity faces expulsion for upsetting the rigid social order of the campus, so its madcap members plan one final act of rebellion against the college dean and a preppy bunch of snobbish bullies at the annual university homecoming parade. Comedy, starring John Belushi, Tim Matheson, Donald Sutherland, Karen Allen and Tom Hulce.(n)

programme.title: Love & Mercy
programme.desc: Biopic of the Beach Boys' Brian Wilson, following the singer-songwriter at two periods in his life. In the 1960s, he is at his creative peak, but haunted by inner demons that take their toll on his mental health. By the 1980s, he is a broken man dominated by a shady doctor, until a new relationship offers him a chance at recovery. Starring John Cusack, Paul Dano, Paul Giamatti and Elizabeth Banks.(n)

programme.title: The Good, the Bad and the Ugly
programme.desc: A laconic gunslinger, a ruthless hired killer and a conniving outlaw hunt for a cache of loot during the chaos of the American Civil War. However, each is privy to only part of the information necessary to find it, setting in motion a series of deadly betrayals. The third film in Sergio Leone's Spaghetti Western trilogy, starring Clint Eastwood as the Man with No Name, with Lee Van Cleef and Eli Wallach. With a soundtrack by Ennio Morricone.(n)

programme.title: Champion
programme.desc: A war veteran criss-crosses America with his disabled brother in tow as he builds a new career as a renowned prizefighter. However, his ruthless determination to make it to the top drives him to betray the people closest to him. Drama, starring Kirk Douglas, Marilyn Maxwell, Arthur Kennedy, Paul Stewart and Ruth Roman.(n)

programme.title: Broadcast News
programme.desc: The highly strung producer of a Washington news bureau falls for a handsome but arrogant and totally untalented new anchorman, but is unaware a humble reporter friend is deeply infatuated with her. Comedy, starring Holly Hunter, William Hurt and Albert Brooks. Featuring an uncredited cameo from Jack Nicholson.(n)

programme.title: The Drop
programme.desc: A Brooklyn bartender secretly provides a service delivering shipments of money to local gangsters. His criminal connections lead to his involvement in a robbery that goes disastrously wrong and digs up the long-buried secrets from his neighbourhood's past. Crime drama based on a short story by Dennis Lehane, starring Tom Hardy, Noomi Rapace and James Gandolfini in his final film role.(n)

programme.title: Love & Mercy
programme.desc: Biopic of the Beach Boys' Brian Wilson, following the singer-songwriter at two periods in his life. In the 1960s, he is at his creative peak, but haunted by inner demons that take their toll on his mental health. By the 1980s, he is a broken man dominated by a shady doctor, until a new relationship offers him a chance at recovery. Starring John Cusack, Paul Dano, Paul Giamatti and Elizabeth Banks.(n)

programme.title: The Good, the Bad and the Ugly
programme.desc: A laconic gunslinger, a ruthless hired killer and a conniving outlaw hunt for a cache of loot during the chaos of the American Civil War. However, each is privy to only part of the information necessary to find it, setting in motion a series of deadly betrayals. The third film in Sergio Leone's Spaghetti Western trilogy, starring Clint Eastwood as the Man with No Name, with Lee Van Cleef and Eli Wallach. With a soundtrack by Ennio Morricone.(n)

programme.title: The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo
programme.desc: A disgraced journalist and a troubled computer hacker are hired by a member of a wealthy family whose niece disappeared 40 years ago. He is convinced she was murdered by one of his own relatives, and wants them to find the evidence - but the family will go to any lengths to conceal their secrets. Mystery thriller based on Stieg Larsson's novel, with Michael Nyqvist and Noomi Rapace. In Swedish and English.

programme.title: The Harry Hill Movie
programme.desc: The quirky comedian is tricked into thinking his hamster has only one week to live, so he and his nan decide to grant the pet's dying wish of a holiday in Blackpool. However, they do not realise they have fallen into a trap set by Harry's evil twin brother. Comedy, starring Harry Hill, Julie Walters, Matt Lucas and Sheridan Smith.

programme.title: Run Wild, Run Free
programme.desc: Withdrawn, mute 10-year-old Philip is ignored by his parents and goes off to explore Dartmoor alone, where he meets a retired colonel who shares his knowledge of Devon's wildlife. Under the older man's nurturing tutelage, the boy begins to tame a wild white colt, but fate proffers a series of setbacks just as real progress is being made. Children's drama, starring John Mills, Mark Lester, Sylvia Syms and Bernard Miles.

programme.title: Ramona and Beezus
programme.desc: Nine-year-old Ramona has a vivid imagination and an unfortunate habit of accidentally causing trouble for herself and everyone else. When her father is fired from his job, the family's lives are thrown into upheaval, and Ramona puts her mind to the task of making sure they do not lose their home. Comedy based on Beverly Cleary's series of books, starring Joey King and Selena Gomez.

programme.title: Jingle All the Way
programme.desc: A workaholic father tries to make up for his perpetual absence from home by promising to buy his son a hugely popular action figure for Christmas - little realising every other father in town has the same idea. Comedy, starring Arnold Schwarzenegger, Sinbad, Jake Lloyd, Rita Wilson, Robert Conrad and Phil Hartman.

programme.title: We Bought a Zoo
programme.desc: A father-of-two struggling to cope with the death of his wife is in need of a fresh start, so buys a house with a dilapidated zoo on the grounds. With the help of the keepers, he works to restore the attraction to its former glory, while also trying to reconnect with his troubled teenage son. Fact-based comedy drama, starring Matt Damon, Scarlett Johansson and Thomas Haden Church.

programme.title: Blood Ties
programme.desc: Premiere. A police officer in 1970s New York takes in his older brother following his release from prison. The cop tries to help his sibling make a fresh start, finding honest work and reconnecting with the family he lost - but conflict erupts as the elder brother returns to a life of crime. Crime drama, starring Clive Owen, Billy Crudup, Marion Cotillard and James Caan.

programme.title: Goon
programme.desc: An underachieving bouncer is the black sheep of a family of doctors, until he beats an ice hockey player in a fight, and is recruited by the team. While he has little sporting prowess, his ability to beat up opposing players leads him to a successful career - and a showdown with his equally violent hero. Comedy, starring Seann William Scott, Jay Baruchel and Liev Schreiber.

programme.title: The Fighter
programme.desc: Fact-based drama about boxer Micky Ward. He is initially trained by his brother, a former fighter who lost everything through drug addiction. Micky is persuaded to sever ties with his family after a series of disastrous fights, but when a shot at the world championship title presents itself, the brothers must reconcile to meet the challenge. With Mark Wahlberg, Amy Adams and Oscar-winning performances from Christian Bale and Melissa Leo.(n)

programme.title: Napoleon Dynamite
programme.desc: A socially inept high-school student and his lonely unemployed brother find their eccentric home life thrown into upheaval when their meddling uncle comes to stay. The teenage oddball tries to make the best of his changing circumstances, while putting all his skills to the task of helping his new best friend win the class presidency. Comedy, starring Jon Heder, Efren Ramirez and Haylie Duff.(n)

programme.title: Captain Ron
programme.desc: An American businessman learns that his recently deceased uncle has left him a yacht moored in the Caribbean, and ill-advisedly puts his trust in a wayward one-eyed mariner to help him and his family sail the vessel back to Miami. Comedy adventure, starring Kurt Russell, Martin Short, Mary Kay Place and Benjamin Salisbury.(n)

programme.title: The Great St Trinian's Train Robbery
programme.desc: A crook and his cronies stash the money from a train heist in a deserted old mansion, planning to recover it in good time. However, several years later, when the thieves arrive to collect their loot, they discover the building has been turned into a school for girls where the pupils have become infamous for their escapades. Comedy, starring Frankie Howerd, Dora Bryan, Reg Varney and George Cole.(n)

programme.title: Coraline
programme.desc: A bored youngster finds a secret door leading to a magical world inhabited by idealised versions of her family and neighbours. Frustrated with her dull real life, she is tempted to stay in this new home - but she soon discovers there is a horrifying price to be paid. Stop-motion animated fantasy based on Neil Gaiman's novel, with the voices of Dakota Fanning and Teri Hatcher.(n)

programme.title: Sister Act
programme.desc: Nightclub singer Deloris Van Cartier agrees to testify against her gangster boyfriend after witnessing a murder. Placed in protective custody by the authorities, she is less than pleased to discover she is expected to pose as chaste nun Sister Mary Clarence in a convent. Comedy, starring Whoopi Goldberg, Harvey Keitel, Maggie Smith, Bill Nunn and Kathy Najimy.(n)

programme.title: Escape Plan
programme.desc: An expert takes a contract from the CIA to test a maximum security prison by trying to break out of it , but he soon discovers he has been duped and that his captors intend him to stay inside forever. He hatches a plan to escape, but to succeed he will need the help of a long-term convict - who wants his own freedom in return for assistance. Thriller, with Sylvester Stallone and Arnold Schwarzenegger.(n)

programme.title: Commando
programme.desc: The daughter of retired special forces officer John Matrix is kidnapped by an old comrade-in-arms, now in league with a deposed former dictator. The tyrant plans to use the girl to force Matrix into assassinating the head of the country he once ruled, but is unprepared for the lengths to which the veteran soldier will go to rescue his child. Action adventure, with Arnold Schwarzenegger and Rae Dawn Chong.(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Olivia thinks John works too hard and tries to persuade him to take some time off, but then receives disturbing news about her own health.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: A stroke of luck saves Jim Bob from certain disaster, and prompts a major change in his outlook on life.

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Part two of two. Charles has a difficult time trying to find someone who will adopt all three Sanderson children. It looks as if the children will get split up, and while they try to be brave, Alicia breaks down at the thought of leaving her brothers and Grace Snider. At the very last moment, Mr Edwards makes a monumental decision.

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: The Ingalls and Oleson families settle their differences when they go camping together.

programme.title: Moonlight & Mistletoe
programme.desc: A businesswoman returns home to help out her Dad's business Santaland after he suffers an injury. Despite her initial reluctance, she soon comes to appreciate the family trade. Drama, starring Candace Cameron Bure, Tom Arnold, Christopher Wiehl and Barbara Niven.

programme.title: Danielle Steel's Palomino
programme.desc: A photographer, struggling to overcome the break-up of her marriage by going to live on a friend's California ranch, where her riding skills impress the ranch hands - one of whom she embarks on a passionate affair with. However, her life takes a turn for the worse when her new lover is unable to cope with the class difference between them and an accident leaves her paralysed. Drama, starring Lee Horsley, Lindsay Frost, Eva Marie Saint and Rod Taylor.

programme.title: Wife, Mother, Murderer
programme.desc: A woman desperate to escape her small town roots murders her husband, attempts to poison her child and assumes multiple fake identities, even going so far as to fake the death of one of her aliases and take on the guise of her own identical twin sister. Fact-based drama, starring Judith Light and David Ogden Stiers.

programme.title: Video Voyeur: The Susan Wilson Story
programme.desc: A woman is understandably horrified to discover her apparently kind-hearted neighbour has somehow managed to install state-of-the-art surveillance equipment throughout her home, so he can spy on her and her family. Fact-based drama, starring Angie Harmon, Jamey Sheridan and Dale Midkiff.

programme.title: Our Gift of Love
programme.desc: A freak accident leaves a man in a coma shortly before Christmas. While friends and family urge his wife to prepare for the worst, she refuses to accept he will not recover and dedicates herself to taking care of him. Drama, starring Rebecca De Mornay, Henry Czerny, Barclay Hope and Lila Yee.

programme.title: Christmas in Canaan
programme.desc: Two boys, one black and the other white, grow up in a racially divided Texas community in the 1960s. The pair take an instant dislike to each other, but their families are determined to end the conflict by forcing them to spend time together. The youngsters grow to become firm friends, but the tension among their neighbours is harder to resolve. Drama, with Jaishon Fisher and Zak Ludwig.

programme.title: The Night They Saved Christmas
programme.desc: Santa's North Pole home is threatened when an oil company plans to drill in the vicinity, but the wife and son of a company employee are enlisted to help save the toy-making village from destruction. Festive fantasy, starring Art Carney, Jaclyn Smith, Paul Le Mat and Mason Adams.

programme.title: God Bless the Child
programme.desc: Poverty and hardship force a single mother and her seven-year-old daughter to move into a shelter for the homeless. Drama, starring Mare Winningham, Grace Johnston and Dorian Harewood.

programme.title: To Live For
programme.desc: A terminally ill woman's last months are made happier by her relationship with a stranger she hopes will take care of her children. Romantic drama, starring Nancy Travis, Scott Bairstow, Jamie Renee Smith, Karen James and Viveka Davis.

programme.title: The Glass House
programme.desc: A former college professor launches a campaign for prison reforms while serving time in a harsh maximum security jail for manslaughter. Drama based on a short story by Truman Capote, starring Alan Alda, Vic Morrow, Dean Jagger and Billy Dee Williams.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Ben enters a photo of Erin in a contest, but does not realise what they intend to do with it. Curt's death makes Mary Ellen become over-protective of her son.(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Elizabeth has to look after the store after Ike has a heart attack, while Ben and Jim Bob go into the molasses business.(n)

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.sub-title: At the End of the Rainbow.
programme.desc: Laura and her friend Jonah find pyrite while fishing in a stream, and mistake it for gold. Laura spends her days amassing the `gold dust', and begins fantasising about her family being wealthy and the Olesons being poor. However the secrecy leads to squabbling.(n)

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: The children have a collection to buy a birthday present for the Rev Alden, but Laura's plan to raise even more money goes badly wrong.(n)

programme.title: The Christmas Choir
programme.desc: A workaholic accountant is forced to reassess his priorities after his devotion to his job costs him his girlfriend. An encounter with a homeless pianist reminds him of his forgotten dream of becoming a musician, so he decides to help the residents of a homeless shelter earn some money by forming a choir. Drama, starring Jason Gedrick and Tyrone Benskin.(n)

programme.title: Danielle Steel's Heartbeat
programme.desc: A pregnant TV producer, abandoned by her husband, falls for an equally lonely divorced colleague, but their romance is threatened by her inability to let go of the past. Drama, starring John Ritter, Polly Draper, Nancy Morgan and Kevin Kilner.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Christmas
programme.desc: An FBI agent reluctantly agrees to keep a close eye on a waitress who put herself in the firing line when she spoke up about her boyfriend's criminal activities. However, the witness protection job takes a turn for the unexpected when the lawman has to return to his hometown for Christmas - dragging the damsel in distress with him. Romantic comedy, starring Jami Gertz, Shawn Christian and Tyne Daly.(n)

programme.title: Hostile Advances: The Kerry Ellison Story
programme.desc: Fact-based drama about a woman who is forced to take on the entire justice system to rid herself of an unbalanced workmate's unwanted attentions - and finds she needs all her reserves of strength to see the case through. Starring Rena Sofer, Victor Garber, Maria Ricossa and Karen Allen.(n)

programme.title: Miracle of the Heart
programme.desc: After losing a patient in surgery, doctor Nathan Andrews takes a break from his career and returns to his small town roots. A chance encounter with an old acquaintance offers him a promise for the future, only for a tragedy to call into question everything he believes. Drama, starring Neil Patrick Harris, Rebecca Gayheart and Rob Lowe.(n)

programme.title: Christmas Every Day
programme.desc: Glum teenager Billy Jackson refuses to get into the yuletide spirit, and lashes out at his exuberant younger sister, Sarah, telling her there is no Father Christmas. In response, young Sarah wishes it could be Christmas every day, and when her request comes true, sullen Billy is forced to relive the holiday over and over again until he is able to appreciate its significance. Festive fantasy, starring Erik von Detten, Bess Armstrong, Yvonne Zima and Robert Hays.(n)

programme.title: On the Second Day of Christmas
programme.desc: A woman and her niece are caught stealing just before Christmas, and face the prospect of spending the festive season in the care of social services - until a kindly shop worker volunteers to put them up. Romantic drama, starring Mary Stuart Masterson and Mark Ruffalo.(n)

programme.title: Jack Reed: One of Our Own
programme.desc: The maverick detective's partner is murdered by a hitman they were investigating and he sets out to bring him to justice with the help of the killer's girlfriend. Thriller, directed by and starring Brian Dennehy. With Susan Ruttan, Charles Dutton and CCH Pounder.(n)

programme.title: Murder of Innocence
programme.desc: A woman's descent into insanity is witnessed by her confused and alienated husband as he battles the authorities to prove she is a danger to society. Drama, starring Valerie Bertinelli and Stephen Caffrey.(n)

programme.title: While Justice Sleeps
programme.desc: A widow is initially delighted by an old family friend's interest in her eight-year-old daughter, but soon starts to suspect the child is being abused. Drama, starring Cybill Shepherd, Tim Matheson, Karis Bryant and Dion Anderson.(n)

programme.title: Highway to Heaven
programme.desc: Jonathan and Mark visit a country and western bar, where they meet a woman who longs to become a singer like her mother and help a dysfunctional family to stay together.

programme.title: Highway to Heaven
programme.sub-title: One Fresh Batch of Lemonade - Part One.
programme.desc: Part one of two. An athlete feels his life is worthless when he loses his legs in a motorcycle accident, so Jonathan steps in to show him what he can still achieve.

programme.title: Gunsmoke
programme.desc: Two drovers find they are unable to compete with the railroad and are forced to turn to crime.

programme.title: Gunsmoke
programme.desc: A farmer insists his three sons get married, so they kidnap a trio of saloon girls to be their brides. Guest starring Harry Morgan (MASH) and William Katt (Carrie).

programme.title: Touched by an Angel
programme.desc: Monica helps a teenager who runs away with the child she promised to give up for adoption. Drama about an angel sent to Earth to help solve people's problems. Roma Downey and Della Reese star.

programme.title: Touched by an Angel
programme.desc: Charles is fearful of an imagined heart condition, but Robin may be the cure to his heart problems. Roma Downey stars.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Grandpa offers a few words of wisdom to Jason, who has just discovered a close friend has been diagnosed as suffering from a terminal illness. Ron Howard guest stars.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Olivia surprises her family by announcing she is going to earn extra money as a door-to-door saleswoman.

programme.title: Danielle Steel's Daddy
programme.desc: An advertising executive's wife walks out, leaving him to raise their children alone - a problem compounded by his mother's death in a car accident. Drama, starring Patrick Duffy, Lynda Carter, Kate Mulgrew and featuring an early appearance by Ben Affleck.

programme.title: Danielle Steel's No Greater Love
programme.desc: A woman endures a seemingly endless series of personal trials and traumas after her parents are killed on the Titanic, but carries on struggling to keep her family together. Period drama, starring Kelly Rutherford, Chris Sarandon, Simon MacCorkindale and Michael Landes.

programme.title: Danielle Steel's Fine Things
programme.desc: A man marries the woman of his dreams, only to see her die of cancer - and while coping with the pain of bereavement, he finds himself subjected to extortionate demands from her drug-dealing ex-husband. Drama, starring DW Moffett, Tracy Pollan and Cloris Leachman.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Jim Bob falls in love with the Baldwin family's cousin, who is preparing to become a nun. Ben hires an unreliable new employee at the mill.

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Isaiah Edwards is mistakenly identified as part of an outlaw gang when the infamous Younger brothers are released from prison and set about rebuilding their reputation.

programme.title: Danielle Steel's Star
programme.desc: A woman dreams of escaping the drudgery of everyday life and becoming a successful singer. A romance with a handsome stranger offers her hope - but the lovebirds are soon separated, and her spirits take another battering. Romantic drama, starring Jennie Garth, Craig Bierko, Terry Farrell and Ted Wass.

programme.title: Danielle Steel's Vanished
programme.desc: A devoted mother's son is kidnapped, and as the FBI search widens, she is distressed to find herself suspected of involvement in the crime, along with a former lover who may not be what he seems. Drama set in the 1930s, starring Lisa Rinna, George Hamilton and Robert Hays.

programme.title: Princess Diana: In Search of Happiness
programme.desc: A review of the life of Diana, Princess of Wales, including her childhood, her move into the public eye, her work for charity, her marriage and her death.

programme.title: Dangerous Indiscretions
programme.desc: Kate Ricketts narrates a documentary examining the British monarchy in the aftermath of the death of Diana, Princess of Wales, and the Windsor family's assorted feuds and divorces. Featuring archive footage of Prince Charles, Sarah Ferguson and Camilla Parker-Bowles.

programme.title: Deacons for Defence
programme.desc: A black man is pushed too far by the racist abuse and unprovoked violent assaults meted out by white bigots in the 1960s, and organises a defence group to fight back. Fact-based drama, starring Forest Whitaker, Adam Weiner, Jonathan Silverman and Serene Lee.

programme.title: Highway to Heaven
programme.sub-title: One Fresh Batch of Lemonade - Part Two.
programme.desc: Part two of two. Jonathan enlists the aid of a gymnast in restoring Deke's faith in himself, and also tries to reconcile the former athlete with his father.(n)

programme.title: Highway to Heaven
programme.desc: Jonathan helps a man who thinks he is King Arthur to make peace with the son who wants to have him committed, while also trying to save a veterinary clinic. Ron Moody guest stars.(n)

programme.title: Gunsmoke
programme.desc: Matt tries to persuade an old friend who has turned to drink to mend his ways.(n)

programme.title: Gunsmoke
programme.desc: Dodge City is rocked by a series of apparently random murders, and Matt fears that Doc may be the next target.(n)

programme.title: Touched by an Angel
programme.desc: The godly helpers assist two women who are in love with the same man. Roma Downey and Della Reese star.(n)

programme.title: Touched by an Angel
programme.desc: A stuffy doctor finds a homeless child on his doorstep claiming to be from Child Watch - but Monica learns the truth and urges him to come clean. Roma Downey and Della Reese star.(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: The Walton clan takes an eight-year-old orphan into the home for a taste of family life.(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: An eerie atmosphere descends over the household as Olivia recalls the strange events that followed the death of a childhood friend.(n)

programme.title: Runaway Car
programme.desc: The accelerator on a woman's car jams, leaving its passengers facing a terrifying ordeal as they attempt to find a way of bringing the vehicle to a stop. Action thriller, with Judge Reinhold, Nina Siemaszko, Brian Hooks and Leon.(n)

programme.title: In the Line of Duty: The Price of Vengeance
programme.desc: A tough-talking hitman sets out to bump off a quartet of local businessman who stand in his way - but he decides to do away with a hard-nosed cop into the bargain, a decision that makes him the target of a furious vendetta. Crime thriller, starring Dean Stockwell, Michael Gross and Brent Jennings.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Christmas
programme.desc: An FBI agent reluctantly agrees to keep a close eye on a waitress who put herself in the firing line when she spoke up about her boyfriend's criminal activities. However, the witness protection job takes a turn for the unexpected when the lawman has to return to his hometown for Christmas - dragging the damsel in distress with him. Romantic comedy, starring Jami Gertz, Shawn Christian and Tyne Daly.(n)

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Jason tries to reform Cousin Boone after he gets in trouble with the law again, and John-Boy's ex-fiancee visits Walton's Mountain.(n)

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Laura wins a writing competition and travels to Minneapolis to meet a publisher who encourages her to pen her first book. However, the editor has other ideas for her work.(n)

programme.title: Wife, Mother, Murderer
programme.desc: A woman desperate to escape her small town roots murders her husband, attempts to poison her child and assumes multiple fake identities, even going so far as to fake the death of one of her aliases and take on the guise of her own identical twin sister. Fact-based drama, starring Judith Light and David Ogden Stiers.(n)

programme.title: Lethal Seduction
programme.desc: A reporter poses as an illegal immigrant and takes a job in the office of a ruthless, seductive lawyer, hoping to expose her corrupt business practices. However, his pursuit of a story is threatened when he becomes infatuated with her. Comedy drama, starring Melanie Griffith and Esai Morales.(n)

programme.title: Princess Diana: A Day in the Life
programme.desc: Documentary examining Lady Diana Spencer's sometimes awkward transition into royalty and the princess's day to day life in the public eye.(n)

programme.title: Prince William & Prince Harry: Prisoners of Celebrity
programme.desc: Documentary exploring how the royals cope with being part of modern celebrity culture.(n)

programme.title: Bloody Sunday
programme.desc: Fact-based drama telling the story of the events of January 30, 1972, when soldiers attached to the Parachute Regiment opened fire on a civil rights march taking place in Londonderry, killing 13 unarmed civilians. Directed by Paul Greengrass and starring James Nesbitt, Nicholas Farrell, Tim Pigott-Smith and Kathy Keira Clarke.(n)

programme.title: The Stanford Prison Experiment
programme.desc: Kyle Patrick Alvarez's drama The Stanford Prison Experiment is based on real events. Dr. Philip Zimbardo (Billy Cruddup) arranges for 24 volunteers to be either guards or inmates a makeshift prison system so that he can observe how their behavior changes. Eventually those playing guards become abusive and dictatorial, while the inmates band together to survive the harsh conditions. What the Stanford professor doesn't expect is that he and the people running the experiment are also being transformed by taking part in it. The Stanford Prison Experiment screened at the 2015 Sundance Film Festival

programme.title: Match
programme.desc: An aging Juilliard dance teacher must face his painful past during an interview with a grad student. Ultimately, the talk could lead to healing or despair for the interviewer's emotionally damaged husband

programme.title: Underclassman
programme.desc: A young detective working undercover at an elite private school discovers the students are operating an international stolen car ring

programme.title: Passion of Mind
programme.desc: Demi Moore stars in this unusual psychological drama about two women caught between reality and imagination. Marie (Moore) is an American widow trying to raise two children under difficult circumstances in a small town in France. Marty (also played by Moore) is a successful businesswoman in New York City who wants to leave her busy life and lead a quieter existence in Europe. But Marty is just a product of Marie's imagination -- or at least that's what Marie thinks. Marty, on the other hand, is convinced that Marie is just someone she dreamed up. Who is right? Or are both of them wrong? And where does it leave the men in their lives (Stellan Skarsgard and William Fichtner)? Passion of Mind was the first English-language film from French director Alain Berliner, best known for the arthouse success Ma Vie en Rose

programme.title: The Trip
programme.desc: A food critic and his obnoxious best friend tour the English countryside in order to review several restaurants

programme.title: Snow Day
programme.desc: Comedy drama about a family's snowy day. Dad is a TV weatherman who tries vainly to get people to listen to his predictions, Mum is a stressed businesswoman without childcare for her toddler, and their eldest son is obsessed by the prettiest girl in the school. But school is closed and his ten-year-old sister decides to sabotage the snowplough and extend the fun for another day

programme.title: Why Did I Get Married?
programme.desc: Tyler Perry wrote, produced, directed and stars in this touching and insightful comedy-drama that he adapted from his successful stage play. Four close couples hash out a variety of relationship issues while on vacation in the Colorado mountains, where a marital blizzard blows in when one of them arrives sans wife but with mistress in tow

programme.title: The Dramatics
programme.desc: When an actress lands a sexually explicit role, her unhappy boyfriend must either accept it or risk losing her

programme.title: Frank & Jesse
programme.desc: Rob Lowe and Bill Paxton star as Frank and Jesse James, who, after the defeat of the South in the Civil War and the pointless murder of their younger brother, seek their own brand of justice. As outlaws, they gain fame for their daring hold-ups of banks, trains, and stagecoaches -- and make sworn enemies of lawmen, who are determined to see them dead

programme.title: As I AM: The Life and Times of DJ AM
programme.desc: Profiling DJ AM (aka Adam Goldstein), a hugely successful and influential disc jockey known for his mash-ups of popular songs. The film traces the course of his life as he found fame and fought to remain sober, only to relapse and die of a drug overdose at the age of 36 following the trauma of surviving a plane crash

programme.title: Ray Donovan
programme.desc: Fish and Bird. Ray waits to see if Belikov will be released from prison and struggles with the prospect of putting a pimp back out on the street. Meanwhile, Teresa spirals into a postpartum depression; and Mickey tries to persuade the DA that he was the sole architect behind the Minassian massacre

He is also intent on discovering if there is any truth in the myth that there is still some land left above water

programme.title: House of the Dead
programme.desc: Adapted from the popular Sega arcade video game of the same name, director Uwe Boll's action horror effort finds a group of partying teens stranded on an island and doing battle with a new breed of unusually mobile zombies. Looking for a place to party away spring break, college students Cynthia (Sonya Salomaa), Greg (Will Sanderson), and Karma (Enuka Okuma) hear rumors of a rave on a remote island in the Seattle area. Rushing to catch the party boat, the teens pick up friends Simon (Tyron Leitso) and Alicia (Ona Grauer), but discover upon arrival at the dock that the boat has set sail without them. Offering a few dollars to a local captain to hitch a ride to the island, the teens reach their destination only to find it eerily silent with no party in sight. Things go from bad to worse when the group is attacked by a mysterious creature, and they are forced to seek refuge in an old dark house on the island shore. Subsequently running into a few familiar faces and learning to their horror that the rave had been overrun by a horde of terrifying zombies, the group must now make one final bid for survival over the course of a long, blood-soaked night(n)

programme.title: Patrick

programme.title: Seventh Moon
programme.desc: A romantic trip to China turns into a lunar nightmare for a pair of happy newlyweds when their taxi driver ditches them in a remote village, and the locals offer them up as sacrifices for the menacing moon creatures that return to Earth annually to replenish their ranks. According to Chinese legend, the dead return to Earth on the seventh month of the lunar year, when the moon glows full in the night sky. America-born Yul (Tim Chiou) and his new wife Melissa (Amy Smart) had just arrived in China to meet Yul's family when their idyllic getaway takes a sudden turn for the worse. When night falls and their tour guide leaves them stranded in a darkened, boarded-up village, Yul and Amy quickly realize that this wasn't a planned stop. Once a year, the lunar creatures return to Earth in search of a sacrifice. Yul and Amy have just been offered up, and now in order to avoid being assimilated into the collective that pursues them through the darkened forest, they will have to survive until the morning light casts the frightful beasts back to the moon for another year(n)

programme.title: The Texas Chainsaw Massacre

programme.title: The Rocketeer
programme.desc: Many people dream of being able to fly, but for young pilot Cliff Secord the dream comes true. He and his mentor Peevy discover a rocket pack that enables whoever straps it on to fly. But he's soon flying into trouble, because other people want the pack too: film star Neville Sinclair is one, and there's also a bunch of Nazis chasing Cliff. So the scene is set for adventure, and the chance for Cliff to become a true American hero(n)

programme.title: Backcountry

programme.title: The Abandoned
programme.desc: An adopted girl returns to her homeland of Russia to explore the dilapidated mountain farm she has recently inherited, only to discover that it harbors a deadly secret in the feature debut from Aftermath director Nacho Cerdà. Shortly after the mysterious death of her birth mother, young Marie was adopted and brought to live in the United States. When Marie receives word that she has inherited an isolated farm in her native Russia, she soon sets out to explore the vast estate and peel away the thick gauze obscuring her secret-shrouded past. Confounded by the local's refusal to show her to the "damned" locale and determined not to give up after coming this far, Marie convinces a man to take her there only to discover that he has inexplicably vanished shortly after arrival. As Marie sets out to explore the ominous and expansive property alone, a surprise encounter with a man named Boris, who claims to have been lured to the house under similar circumstances, sets into motion a chilling series of events in which the ghosts of the past -- as well as deceased doppelgangers of both Marie and Boris -- prevent the frightened pair from leaving. In the terrifying hours that follow, both of these tormented lost souls will find that sometimes the past is best left forgotten(n)

programme.title: Bubble Boy
programme.desc: Jake Gyllenhaal, the young star of the critically well-received October Sky (1999), follows up that film with this offbeat comedy. Gyllenhaal stars as Jimmy Livingston, a teenager with an immune system deficiency who has spent his entire life living in a plastic bubble under the doting, overprotective care of his mother (Swoosie Kurtz). Jimmy is in love with his next-door neighbor Chloe (Marley Shelton), so when he learns that she has left for Niagara Falls in order to be married, he's devastated. He quickly assembles a portable "bubble suit" and sets out on a 2,755.8-mile odyssey in order to stop her and proclaim his affection. Along the way, Jimmy experiences a number of adventures, including encounters with freaks, bikers, rock stars, and a cult. Bubble Boy is a comic riff on the classic TV movie The Boy in the Plastic Bubble (1976), which starred a young John Travolta

This spunky love interest soon becomes the student, with the wandering warrior passing along his knowledge so that she can enact revenge against scarred scumbag The Colonel (Danny Huston). As the master tracks the sound of the warrior's sword (literally), the samurai makes one final stand with the town to thwart The Colonel and his gang before they burn it all down. A relentless serial killer is stalking the streets of the San Francisco Bay Area, leaving citizens locked into a constant state of panic, and baffled authorities scrambling for clues. Though the killer sadistically mocks the detectives by leaving a series of perplexing ciphers and menacing letters at the crime scenes, the investigation quickly flatlines when none of the evidence yields any solid leads. Scotty buys an antique desk and -- hidden in a secret compartment -- he finds a letter from a woman named Elizabeth Whitcomb (Jennifer Jason Leigh), who lived during the 19th century. Fascinated by the letter, Scotty writes her a reply, using antique writing materials, and is shocked when he receives a reply -- somehow he's been able to communicate with her through time, and they begin a correspondence that spans a century and a half. It turns out that Elizabeth is also pledged to marry, but she does not love her fiancée, and a romance begins to blossom through the mail and across time. programme.title: K-19: The Widowmaker
programme.desc: Inspired by a true story, the film follows the heroism of Captain Alexei Vostrikov who, at the height of the Cold War, is ordered to take command of the nuclear missile submarine K-19 away from its original commander Captain Mikhail Polenin. Vostrikov's mission is to quickly ready the ill-prepared sub for her maiden voyage - no matter what the cost. But Vostrikov, Polenin and K-19's loyal crew can never imagine all that is expected of them. Neither can they fathom what the price of failure might be for them and for the world when a nuclear reactor malfunctions, threatening a core meltdown and an explosion that will certainly kill all aboard. As they glide beneath the Arctic seas, it is the crew's collective bravery and Vostrikov's daring embrace of his duty toward his country and his men which will ultimately save K-19... and stave off what surely would have been a nuclear disaster(n)

programme.title: The Uninvited
programme.desc: Filmmaking duo Thomas and Charles Guard make their feature directorial debuts as the co-directors of this remake of Kim Jee-woon's 2003 Korean film A Tale of Two Sisters. Produced by Asian horror remake king Roy Lee, The Uninvited tells the story of a young girl named Anna (Emily Browning), who was admitted into a mental hospital following the death of her biological mother. Returning home some time later, Anna is shocked to discover that her father (David Strathairn) has recently gotten engaged to Rachel (Elizabeth Banks), her mother's former nurse. Anna's suspicions about Rachel are soon confirmed when her mother reaches out from the beyond to deliver a stark warning, prompting the young girl and her sister (Arielle Kebbel) to try and convince their father that Rachel is not who she appears to be. As the situation in the once-peaceful household rapidly begins to deteriorate, Rachel's true colors finally begin boiling to the surface

programme.title: Looking: The Movie
programme.desc: Patrick returns to San Francisco after spending nearly a year in Denver, but while he's in town for a wedding, he also must confront some unresolved relationships he left in his rearview mirror(n)

programme.title: Barbershop
programme.desc: Calvin (Ice Cube) never wanted to take over the family business, a barbershop on the south side of Chicago. Disgusted with the shop's crime-ridden neighborhood, and caught up in his moneymaking schemes, one morning Calvin decides to sell the shop to the shady Lester (Keith David). Chastised by his pregnant wife, Jennifer (Jazsmin Lewis), for his rash decision, Calvin spends the day cutting heads at the shop, and starts to understand the importance of the legacy his grandfather and father have left to him. The bickering barbers include Eddie (Cedric the Entertainer), the old-timer with his own unique perspective on black life; Terri (rapper Eve in her film debut), a hot-tempered woman with a trifling boyfriend; Jimmy (Sean Patrick Thomas), a college educated snob; Ricky (Michael Ealy) a reformed criminal; Isaac (Troy Garity, the son of Jane Fonda and Tom Hayden), a white B-Boy, whom no one is ready to let cut their hair; and Dinka (Leonard Howze), a recent African immigrant who's too shy to express his feelings for Terri. Calvin learns to appreciate them all, and discovers that the place where they work is more than just a place to get a haircut -- it's a meeting place for the neighborhood, a place where folks can speak their minds and find out what's happening. Calvin gradually changes his mind about selling the shop, but it may be too late. Meanwhile, a bumbling thief, J.D. (Anthony Anderson) spends a painful day trying to crack open the ATM he's stolen from the grocery store across the street. Barbershop was directed by Tim Story and produced by George Tillman Jr. and Robert Teitel, the producers of Soul Food. Barbershop had its world premiere at the 2002 Urbanworld Film Festival(n)

programme.title: Standing Still

programme.title: Friday Night Lights
programme.desc: H.G. Bissinger's best-selling true-life account of a few months in the life of a high-school football team comes to the screen in this adaptation written and directed by Peter Berg. Odessa, TX, is an oil town in the western part of the state that's home to the Permian High School Panthers, the football team with the best winning record in the state. Odessa is a town with more than its share of problems; the decline of the oil business in Texas has set the city's economy into a tailspin, and racial tensions still erupt into violence on occasion. But football is the one thing that brings all the people of Odessa together, and on Friday nights every fall, as many as 20,000 people fill Permian's football stadium to watch Coach Gary Gaines (Billy Bob Thornton) and his boys try to lead the team to victory. As Gaines works to build a winning team in a town where victory is prized above all else, however, his players struggle through the emotional trials common to any teenager and ponder the fact that there is little future in their hometown...and that a championship season can be as much a burden as a triumph. Friday Night Lights also stars Lucas Black, Derek Luke, Jay Hernandez, and country singer-turned-actor Tim McGraw(n)

Successfully rescued and back on Earth, he gives up his career to join a large corporation, much to the relief of his wife Charlize Theron (soon to be seen in Reindeer Games ). But, as he starts to act more strangely, she begins to wonder what actually happened in those 120 seconds and what this could mean for their unborn child

programme.title: The Theory of Everything
programme.desc: James Marsh's biopic of the celebrated scientist Stephen Hawking, The Theory of Everything, stars Eddie Redmayne as the famous figure. Enrolled as a graduate student at Cambridge, Hawking establishes himself as one of the leading minds of his generation, and begins to win the heart of Jane (Felicity Jones). After one of his earliest breakthroughs, Hawking is diagnosed with ALS, and he becomes less and less able to control his own body. With the loyal Jane at his side, he continues his work. However, as the years progress, Jane starts to feel more like a nurse than a wife, and Hawking begins to have feelings for a woman who is hired to care for him. The Theory of Everything screened at the 2014 Toronto International Film Festival

programme.title: A Beautiful Mind

However, when he is recruited to provide assistance to the military with top-secret code-breaking duties, the high-pressure job takes its toll on him and he begins to develop a mental illness. Dir: Ron Howard

programme.title: Other People's Money
programme.desc: A satirical look at the values of 1980s America, based on the popular off-Broadway play. An unscrupulous Wall Street asset stripper sees his chance to make a fast buck with the takeover and break-up of a small but profitable family-run company. The laid-back owner has no intention of selling, however, and calls in a talented lawyer who is as manipulative as the money-grabbing adversary she attempts to out-manoeuvre

programme.title: Wall Street
programme.desc: Oliver Stone's morality tale stars Charlie Sheen as Bud Fox, an ambitious young stockbroker, who's willing to do whatever it takes to emulate his hero, supremely wealthy financier Gordon Gekko. Bud's initial attempts to play the market honestly don't light his touchpaper to success. But, when he passes on some insider information to Gekko, his career starts to pick up pace and, as he becomes increasingly embroiled in illegal trading and financial espionage, he begins to make the money of his dreams. However, he fails to fully comprehend the true cost of his deals until one of them threatens the livelihood of his union boss father. Also starring Daryl Hannah and Terence Stamp

programme.title: Eulogy
programme.desc: Writer/director Michael Clancy makes his feature film debut with the black comedy Eulogy. Zooey Deschanel plays Kate Collins, an unhappy college student who is made even more unhappy when her grandfather (Rip Torn) dies. Even though the entire family hates each other, they reunite at the home of Grandma Collins (Piper Laurie). Among other family members, Kate observes a war between her washed-up actor dad, Daniel (Hank Azaria); her lesbian Aunt Lucy (Kelly Preston); her wound-up Uncle Skip (Ray Romano); and her strict Aunt Alice (Debra Winger). Tensions escalate and family secrets are ultimately revealed. Kate is also inundated with the eulogy-writing duties, as she's the only one capable of such a task. Meanwhile, she reunites with old flame Ryan Carmichael (Jesse Bradford). Eulogy premiered at the Sundance Film Festival in 2004(n)

The Gladers partner with resistance fighters to take on WCKD in an attempt to discover their plans for the future in this young-adult dystopian thriller from 20th Century Fox. programme.title: A Walk Among the Tombstones
programme.desc: A heroin trafficker whose wife was abducted and murdered hires a haunted private investigator to track down the men who killed her in this brooding crime drama starring Liam Neeson. Matt Scudder (Neeson) was an NYPD cop having a quiet drink in a Washington Heights bar when a pair of armed robbers came in guns blazing. Giving chase, Scudder kills the robbers in the street, though a stray bullet turns a heroic moment tragic. Devastated, Scudder subsequently goes to work as an unlicensed private detective, working just outside of the law and surviving on generous gifts offered in exchange for his services. Now, tasked with rooting out the sadistic thugs who brutally murdered the wife of a wealthy drug dealer (Dan Stevens), Scudder scours the bars and back alleys of New York City in search of his elusive targets -- and the closer he gets, the more apparent it becomes that they are something much more sinister than your typical kidnappers(n)

programme.title: Borat: Cultural Learnings of America for Make Benefit Glorious Nation of Kazakhstan
programme.desc: Larry Charles's spoof documentary follows Borat Sagdiyev, Kazakhstan's leading journalist and TV presenter, as he travels through the heart of America in an attempt to understand the land of the free and the home of the brave. Along the way, he's able to congratulate a packed rodeo crowd for their country's 'war of terror', enjoy a dinner with the cream of Southern society and engage in an unforgettable hotel-room wrestle that spills into a shocked conference hall. Sacha Baron Cohen stars as the eponymous Borat, scabrously exposing smalltown America's prejudices in the company of his producer Azamat Bagatov. Other highlights include the two men engaged in nude wrestling and, of course, Borat's kidnapping of Pamela Anderson. In English, and Romanian, Hebrew, Polish and Armenian with English subtitles

programme.title: Blazing Saddles
programme.desc: Mel Brooks' send-up of Hollywood Westerns

programme.title: Death Defying Acts
programme.desc: Catherine Zeta-Jones and Guy Pearce display a mesmerizing screen magic in this intriguing romantic drama set in 1926 Edinburgh. Zeta-Jones plays a beautiful con artist who poses as a fake medium to bilk illusionist Harry Houdini (Pearce), who has offered $10,000 to any psychic who can conjure up his late mother's final words. While getting to know the grifter, the famous escape artist begins to develop a personal attachment to her. Saoirse Ronan. Directed by Gillian Armstrong

programme.title: O Brother, Where Art Thou?
programme.desc: Picaresque comedy set in 1930s Mississippi about three convicts who escape from prison and set off to collect some hidden loot before it gets flooded by a new dam project. Loosely based on Homer's Odyssey, the plot involves a number of comic escapades, including accidentally becoming a hit country band, and encounters with Baby Face Nelson, a blind prophet and three 'sirens'

programme.title: Cop Land
programme.desc: Sylvester Stallone puts in an acclaimed performance as the sheriff of the small town of Garrison, New Jersey, home for a group of corrupt New York cops who find themselves under investigation in this richly characterised thriller. Freddy Heflin is a small town sheriff who is in awe of the many New York cops who live in, and effectively run, his town, led by Uncle Ray (Harvey Keitel). He is forced to re-evaluate his opinion of these men, and of his own worth, when Internal Affairs officer Moe Tilden (Robert De Niro) comes to town and tries to recruit him into an investigation into their activities. Tilden is convincing, but the question remains, will the exhausted and self-loathing Heflin find the moral courage to battle the very people he has revered for so long, or will his apathy and world-weariness prove unconquerable? Either way, it will prove a difficult journey

programme.title: Birdman or (The Unexpected Virtue of Ignorance)
programme.desc: A fading actor, best known for his portrayal of a superhero, plans a comeback by appearing in a Broadway play in this blisteringly funny showbiz satire. However, his attempts to become more altruistic, rebuild his career and reconnect with friends and family prove more difficult than expected

programme.title: El Cantante
programme.desc: Pop icon Marc Anthony steps into the role of Salsa superstar Hector Lavoe in this biopic that follows the singer from his early career success as a Puerto Rican teen sensation to his later status as a New York City Latin idol while also documenting his ongoing struggle against drug and alcohol addiction. Actress and pop star Jennifer Lopez co-stars as Puchi; Lavoe's longtime muse and love interest

programme.title: Batman Returns
programme.desc: The Caped Crusader is called into action again to foil the plans of a grotesque super-villain, the Penguin. Batman's alter-ego, Bruce Wayne, has a yen for a timid secretary - who mysteriously transforms herself into Catwoman, sworn to vengeance against her former boss, one of the Penguin's evil cronies. When a flotilla of missile-carrying penguins advances on Gotham City, Batman needs all the help he can get

programme.title: Hitman: Agent 47
programme.desc: Agent 47 (Rupert Friend), known only by the barcode tattoo on his neck, is an elite international assassin. Engineered to be an unstoppable killing machine, 47 is contracted by a covert organization to assassinate high-profile targets on a global scale. He's given the assignment to kill the leader of a crime syndicate who wishes to unlock the secrets behind 47's powers and harness that information into an army of highly skilled hit men. As 47 races to complete his mission, new information emerges about his origins and sparks a race against time as the agent is hunted for the secrets behind his skills. Aleksander Bach directs this reboot of the 2007 action thriller Hitman

programme.title: Wonder Woman
programme.desc: A graceful Amazon princess of untold strength and beauty attempts to prevent the god of war from instigating a conflict that will last for centuries and destroy the human race as the animated adventure marking the return of DC Comics heroine Wonder Woman. On the mystical island of Themyscira lives a fierce race of warrior Amazons who have raised a powerful daughter named Princess Diana. The Amazons live in secrecy from the outside world, but when Army fighter pilot Steve Travor crash-lands in their tropical paradise, the headstrong princess defies the law of the land by accompanying Trevor back to civilization. But her transition into the modern world won't be an easy one, because when Ares escapes from his Amazonian prison and begins plotting his revenge, Princess Diana is the only person who stands between the god of war, and the destruction of the human race - beginning with the Amazons. Now, as Princess Diana harnesses her unique powers to boldly fight back against Ares and save the planet from certain destruction, Wonder Woman is born and the battle for civilization begins(n)

programme.title: Lucky Numbers
programme.desc: John Travolta plays Russ Richards, a small-town weatherman who is such a local celebrity that he even has his own table at the local Denny's. programme.title: What Happens in Vegas
programme.desc: Career woman Joy heads off to Las Vegas to cheer herself up after being very publicly dumped by her boyfriend. Fate leads her to meeting amiable slacker Jack and the new friends soon enjoy a boozy evening. Later that evening, rather drunk, they end up getting hitched. As reality dawns the next morning, the duo plan to divorce as quickly as they married. But Jack wins a massive amount of money, after putting one of Joy's coins in a slot machine. Their squabble over the money leads to a judge freezing the assets and sentencing them to make a go of their marriage - for at least six months. Tom Vaughan's romantic comedy also stars Queen Latifah as the marriage guidance expert who tries to keep the couple together(n)

programme.title: Fracture
programme.desc: Anthony Hopkins, as a diabolical homicide suspect, and Ryan Gosling as the dogged prosecutor on his tail are equally fascinating as they engage in a deadly game of cat and mouse in this absorbing legal thriller. Hopkins is a brilliant engineer who is literally trying to get away with murder---his wife's---and Gosling is the DA whose case is not as open-and-shut as he thought it would be. Directed by Gregory Hoblit(n)

programme.title: Under Siege
programme.desc: Casey Ryback is a former Navy SEAL captain who is now the cook aboard the USS Missouri. Everyone aboard is about to celebrate the birthday of Captain Adams. They've even hired a band led by William Strannix, and former playboy playmate Jordan Tate to jump out of a cake and dance. What Adams doesn't know is that he is in for a deadly surprise(n)

Sin City author Frank Miller's sweeping take on the historic Battle of Thermopylae comes to the screen courtesy of Dawn of the Dead director Zack Snyder. Gerard Butler stars as Spartan King Leonidas and Lena Headey plays Queen Gorgo. The massive army of the Persian Empire is sweeping across the globe, crushing every force that dares stand in its path. When a Persian envoy arrives in Sparta offering King Leonidas power over all of Greece if he will only bow to the will of the all powerful Xerxes (Rodrigo Santoro), the strong-willed leader assembles a small army comprised of his empire's best fighters and marches off to battle. Though they have virtually no hope of defeating Xerxes' intimidating battalion, Leonidas' men soldier on, intent on letting it be known they will bow to no man but their king. Meanwhile, back in Sparta, the loyal Queen Gorgo attempts to convince both the skeptical council and the devious Theron (Dominic West) to send more troops despite the fact that many view Leonidas' unsanctioned war march as a serious transgression. As Xerxes' fearsome "immortals" draw near, a few noble Greeks vow to assist the Spartans on the battlefield. When King Leonidas and his 300 Spartan warriors fell to the overwhelming Persian army at the Battle of Thermopylae, the fearless actions of the noble fighters inspired all of Greece to stand up against their Persian enemy and wage the battle that would ultimately give birth to the modern concept of democracy(n)

programme.sub-title: Thera's Awesome Date with Destiny/Erik the Biking.
programme.desc: Double bill. Noam invents a high-tech crystal ball. Thera discovers Chet will be her prom date unless she can undo the goofy chain of events that lead to her date fate. After Les's new bike gets trashed by Chet, the team rebuilds it, complete with the soul of an ancient Viking warrior. Soon Les is conquering his way into big Viking trouble.

programme.title: Randy Cunningham: 9th Grade Ninja
programme.sub-title: When Howie Met Randy/Bro Money Bro Problems'.
programme.desc: Double bill. In a flashback episode, six-year-old Randy tries to convince new kid Howard that Norrisville has a Ninja by sneaking out of daycare and into the high school. Then, when Randy lets Howard sell used Ninja weapons for cash, the boys unwittingly sell them to Viceroy, who uses the weapons to build the Ninja's ultimate foe.

programme.title: Wander Over Yonder
programme.desc: Double bill. Lord Hater ditches Peepers to party with Emperor Awesome. Then, Sylvia discovers Wander's new obsession with funny cat videos is part of a more fiendish viral plot.

programme.title: Dude, That's My Ghost
programme.desc: Double bill. Ponzi finds a `no weirdos' rule in the school handbook so invites himself to the Wright home to get the evidence he needs to kick Spencer out of school.

programme.title: Dude, That's My Ghost
programme.sub-title: School of Rockers/How to Impress Ladies.
programme.desc: Double bill. Spencer fears he is going to bomb at the school talent show, but when Billy gets mixed into a batch of Jane's brownies, Spencer has bigger problems. Then, Spencer is nominated for an award, but is only allowed to take one guest to the ceremony.

programme.title: Kid vs Kat
programme.sub-title: Trespassers Will Be Persecuted/Oh Me, Oh Meow.
programme.desc: Double bill. Old Lady Munson tells Coop he is not allowed in her yard, but with the help of a giant water balloon sling, Kat makes sure that he crosses the line repeatedly. Later, Kat ends up with a conditioning collar to curb his demanding meows, but turns the tables by attaching it to Coop.

programme.title: Kid vs Kat
programme.desc: Double bill. Coop decides to allow his pet to hatch his invasion plans as he never gets any credit for stopping him. Later, Kat wants to turn Bootsville Beach into a rubbish dump for the Kat Nebula.

programme.title: Randy Cunningham: 9th Grade Ninja
programme.desc: Double bill. When a frozen student from the 1980s is thawed and stanked, Randy and Howard must reunite him with his lost love before the school is destroyed. programme.title: Randy Cunningham: 9th Grade Ninja
programme.desc: Double bill. Randy has to learn a valuable lesson about respect and humility after accidently breaking his sword. Then, a freaky new exchange student threatens to ruin Randy and Howard's friendship.

But it gets stuck in the worst possible place: the dreaded Friendzone. Getting them past that is the kids' biggest challenge yet. It's only temporary, until they find a bigger place, but the resulting chaos drives Millie, Lauren, Fran and Jake round to Mum's. And Millie has an ulterior motive: getting Craig to look after the hyper Jake as revenge for his annoying behaviour. She thinks it'll teach him to be a better brother - but Jake thinks Craig is pretty cool as he is, and starts imitating his teenage ways.
